results.title: Women in management: threat or opportunity
results.creator_credit: Barbara Jampel, CRM Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Examines the effects of the women’s liberation movement in several different organisations and then shows the many ways, both good and bad, in which leaders and managers are dealing with the situation. Shows how a traditionally male-dominated company has adapted to changing sex roles through an organised program. This film can be used to explore the possible attitudes and hindrances to career progress which girls may face. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Women in mainstream cinema
results.creator_credit: Geoff Cawthorn, Ian Phipps, Margaret Pomeranz, AFTRS and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Why are women so absent in terms of story, character and integrity, age and exprience in mainstream cinema? Is it just too threatening to have women portrayed as they are in real life, or is it that women’s issues are not real issues? Why could women on screen in the 30’s and 40’s be much more than the undevelopped romantic props they often are today. Hear what top Australian critics think and then have your say.

results.title: Women in kimono
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and Koga Productions
results.brief_description: A look at Japanese culture showing the influence of nature in all spheres of life. With no narration, using only Japanese music as background, the film shows the design of fabrics for kimonos, the making of delicate porcelain, silk screen painting and ikebana.

results.title: Women at war
results.creator_credit: John Oliver, British Railways and Topical Press Agency
results.brief_description: Shows the response by the women of Britain during the second World War performing the multitude of tasks, normally carried out by men, necessary to keep the railways running efficiently.

results.title: Women and work: Changes over three generations
results.brief_description: There are many factors which have influenced the changes that have taken place in the world of paid work for women, these include: access to higher education; Equal Opportunity laws; the availability of child care; the impact of domestic and work-related technology; and, family leave for fathers. This video is based on interviews with three Australian women, each representing a different generation. Lynne McLennan, a 37 year old senior public servant, Rosemary West, a well known 53 year old journalist with a perspective on working in the 1960s and Marcella Pearce, a 74 year old retired secretary who began working in the 1930s. The video is presented in five segments: Career Decisions; Pregnancy and child care; Changes in the workplace; Issues in the workplace and Personal values. Teachers notes are included.

results.title: Women and sexuality: a century of change (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dan Klugherz, Arthur Zitrin and Altana Films
results.brief_description: Provides an informative, historically accurate and entertaining history of past ideas about sexuality as well as a basis for discussion of current sexual issues. Commentary by Barbara Mitchell, Shirley Oliver, Linda Wahl and Judy Zangwill.

results.title: Women and education
results.creator_credit: P.R.S. Pillay, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A fascinating early feminist documentary from India focusing on women and education. Through a framing story of a young girl’s graduation from High School and the choices she confronts, the film provides a historical account of female eminence in pre-Hindi Indian culture and society. Further, it describes the contemporary struggle for female emancipation while stressing the opportunities and responsibilities that influence our protagonist’s decision. A technically accomplished film with beautiful cinematography and a fine soundtrack of Indian classical music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: P.R.S. Pillay, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Women alone
results.creator_credit: Bob Kingsbury, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film dramatises the problems of two women faced with difficult personal situations - financial duress followed by emotional breakdown in one instance and a suicide attempt following desertion and the depressing circumstances which this brought about in the second instance. In both cases the women are helped towards independence by the Widows Training Scheme.

results.title: Women's hockey umpiring
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates the rules for hockey as seen by the umpire. Rules and play are demonstrated during play at an international match. Made under the technical direction of the Midland Counties Women’s Hockey Association.

results.title: Women's gymnastics
results.creator_credit: Dr Frank Ryan and Ryan Films
results.brief_description: Various routines - prescribed or imaginative - must be performed in both national and international competition; on the balance -beam, the uneven parallel bars; the side-horse, and floor exercises. Judges score from zero to ten, depending on the performer’s competence and confidence.
